title: Good Omens Episode 1 Review "In The Beginning"
author: Nerdrotic
comment: I'm a devout Christian and I enjoyed this show. Honestly, my faith took less of a beating from this mythology than in a given season of Supernatural LOL! I was actually pleasantly surprised how reverently the Crucifixion scene was treated in a later episode, especially knowing the current social environment and the authors' personal views.
Good Omens should be a master class on how to adapt a book. Everything (especially David Tennant) is so well-executed and looks beautiful.

Funny thing is, "Subverting expectations" is a very common occurrence in the literature. The only difference is, when you read a good book, written by an intelligent writer, every time he/she manages to surprise you, you go mentally through the plot leading to this and realize it is all there, just hidden carefully.
I loved this series so much.  David tennant is a master actor.   And the writing flows so well.
Thanks for the entertaining and positive outlook.  Agreed, Michael Sheen would be a fantastic Doctor.  RIP Douglas and Terry.  A massive thank you to Neil Gaiman...
description:
